oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Performance - Rick Palieri - 2017-10-15
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Musician spotlight program featuring Rick Palieri from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on October 15, 2017.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Rick Palieri; Nina Richey;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:06) Opening comments by Ali Tonn and introduction of Rick Palieri / (02:58) Performs Going Down That Road Feelin' Bad (vocal with banjo accompaniment) / (05:51) Opening comments from Rick and talk about Pete Seeger / (06:46) Performs She'll Be Coming 'Round the Mountain / (11:20) Talks about traveling around the country and learning how to play the native American flute / (15:32) Plays the flute / (17:23) Talks about traveling to Indian reservations and learning about story telling / (19:07) Performs unidentified song / (22:45) Talks about the picking bow and performs The Baby-O / 23:56 Talks about Jimmie Driftwood and tells story / (26:16) Performs The Ballad Of New Orleans / (29:01) Talks about the piccolo banjo / (30:01) Performs The Old Chisholm Trail / (31:03) Talks about the African banjo / (32:05) Performs Hambone / Talks about the evolution of the banjo / (33:32) Performs Old Joe Clark / (36:53) Talks about hobos and traveling /

(39:54) Performs unidentified song probably titled I'm Riding On The West Bound / (43:44) More hobo stories and finishes previous song / (46:32) Introduces Nina Richey and comments from Nina / (48:07) Performs unidentified song probably titled If I Could Turn Back The Hands of Time (Rick and Nina on vocals) / (51:14) Talks about the jacket that he's wearing / (52:45) Performs We Are Climbing Jacob's Ladder (Rich vocal and guitar) / (56:55) Talks about the next song / (57:24) Performs Will The Circle Be Unbroken (Rich and Nina) / (59:50) Performs Swing Low Sweet Chariot (Rick and Nina) / (01:01:15) Final comments from Rick / (01:01:27) Walk-out music / (01:05:36) End walk-out music / (01:05:58) FILE END
